suncertify.db
Interface DBMain

All Known Implementing Classes:
Data
public interface DBMain

Define an interface for database file records create, read, lock, update and delete operations.

The implementation must assure that updates and deletes operations can only occur on locked record.

For update operation(s), the caller must lock the record by calling lock(int) then unlock it after finishing the update operation(s) by calling unlock(int), but for delete, the caller only has to call lock(int) before calling delete(int), no need to unlock the record after delete because it does not exist any more.
Updating for primary keys field is prohibited, update(int, java.lang.String[]) only modifies non primary keys fields, to update a primary key, the record must be deleted then reinserted again using new unique record number.

An instance of this interface can be obtained from Session.getDataAccess(). Data is a suitable implementation of this interface which can be used by many database file engine providers.

Author:
Mohammad S. Abdellatif
See Also:
Session, Data

Method Detail

read

java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
                        throws RecordNotFoundException
Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be read.
Returns:
the record fields values.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record with record number recNo is not found in file or is marked as deleted.

update

void update(int recNo,
            java.lang.String[] data)
            throws RecordNotFoundException
Modifies non primary key field(s) of a record.

The new value for field n appears in data[n]. Record will be updated if and only if the record was locked by the client. If field data[n] contents length is larger than the expected field size it will be trimmed, if it is smaller it will be padded with spaces at the rear, null field value will be treated the same as empty string.
Updating for record primary key field(s) is prohibited, an IllegalStateException will be thrown if primary key field(s) passed through data are differ from current value(s) in database file.
An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown to indicate on of the following:

  • Number of fields passed does not match the exact number of fields in database
  • One of the fields value is larger than expected size.
  • One of the primary keys fields or non-null field passed value is null or empty.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be updated.
data - the new values of record fields.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record with record number recNo is not found in file, marked as deleted or is not locked.

delete

void delete(int recNo)
            throws RecordNotFoundException
Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse or just mark the record status as delete.

The record will be deleted if and only if the record was locked by the client. After a successful call to this method there is no need to unlock the record by calling unlock(int) because it does not exit any more.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be deleted.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record with record number recNo is not found in file or is marked as deleted or record is not locked by the client.

find

int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws RecordNotFoundException
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria, criteria matching is case insensitive.

Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null or empty value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "freddy".)
It throws IllegalArgumentException is fields count in passed criteria does not match fields number in database.

Parameters:
criteria - criteria which records will be matched with.
Returns:
an array of record numbers that match criteria specified in criteria array.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when no records match criteria.

create

int create(java.lang.String[] data)
           throws DuplicateKeyException
Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given dbMain, and returns the record number of the new record.

if field data[n] is smaller than expected size it will be padded with spaces.null field value will be treated the same as empty string.
It throws IellgalArgumentException to indicate one of the following:

  • Empty or null values in primary key(s).
  • Number of fields passed does not match the exact number of fields in database
  • One of the fields value is larger than expected size.

Parameters:
data - the new record fields to be created.
Returns:
the record number of the new record.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - when new record key field(s) have duplicated values in file.

lock

void lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.

If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be locked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record to be locked is not found in database file.

unlock

void unlock(int recNo)
            throws RecordNotFoundException
Releases the lock on a record.

Throws IllegalStateException is record is not locked by caller.

Parameters:
recNo - record number for the record to be unlocked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record to be unlocked is not found in database file.

isLocked

boolean isLocked(int recNo)
                 throws RecordNotFoundException
Determines if a record is currently locked.

Returns true if the record is locked, false otherwise

Parameters:
recNo - record number for the record which its lock to be checked.
Returns:
true if record is locked, false otherwise.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - when record which its lock status to be determine is not found.
